title: Stochastic Oscillator
content:
# Stochastic Oscillator

Stochastics compare a specific closing price of a security to a range of its prices over a certain period of time.

## Calculation
`%K = (Current Close - Lowest Low) / (Highest High - Lowest Low) * 100`
`%D = 3-day SMA of %K`

## Signals
Similar to RSI, but more sensitive.
*   > 80: Overbought.
*   < 20: Oversold.
code:
import pandas as pd

df = pd.DataFrame({
    'High': [10, 12, 15, 14, 13],
    'Low': [8, 9, 11, 10, 9],
    'Close': [9, 11, 14, 12, 10]
})

period = 5
low_min = df['Low'].rolling(window=period).min()
high_max = df['High'].rolling(window=period).max()

# Fast Stochastic
df['%K'] = 100 * ((df['Close'] - low_min) / (high_max - low_min))

# Slow Stochastic
df['%D'] = df['%K'].rolling(window=3).mean()

print(df.tail())
